relevant_findings.neurologic_examination: Fully alert, oriented, speech with occasional hesitation, intact perception for pinprick and light touch except for great toes.
relevant_findings.motor_function: 5/5, slight pronator drift, very mild foot drop, questionable limitation in grip strength on right.
relevant_findings.reflexes: Biceps jerks +++ bilaterally; right knee jerk ++, left +; no ankle jerks; equivocal plantar responses.

relevant_findings.neurologic_examination: Confusion, considerable word-finding difficulty, right-side neglect, slightly weaker grip strength on right, mildly hyperactive tendon reflexes on right, right-sided Babinski reflex.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Neurologic function declined with increased confusion and difficulties in function on the fifth hospital day.
Significant improvement in neurologic symptoms over time, returned to normal temperature, confusion resolved.
